SX0017/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDV/HANNOVER VALIDITY: 26APR24 - 19JUL24 CONSTRUCTION WORK AT HANNOVER AIRPORT (2 PHASES) IN UNFAVOURABLE MET CON (DRY AND WINDY), THE LARGE-SCALE CONSTRUCTION WORK MAY CAUSE VIS ACCUMULATIONS OF DUST. DURING THE ENTIRE CONSTRUCTION MEASURE, A PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILANE WILL BE ESTABLISHED TO CONNECT APRON GA3. ALL ACFT FROM AND TO APRON GA3 MAY BE TOWED ONLY FROM TWY M WHERE IT MEETS THE PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILANE. ADDITINAL RESTRICTIONS BY NTM. ***PHASE 1: 26APR24 - 24MAY24*** THE FOLLOWING FACILITIES IN THE AREA OF THE NORTHERN OPERATING AREAS WILL BE CLSD: RWY 09L/27R, TWY G, TWY H, TWY J, TWY K, TWY KTO, TWY L BTN RWY 09C/27C AND RWY 09L/27R, TWY M BTN THE PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILANE TO GA3 AND RWY 09L/27R, TWY N, TWY Q (CONNECTION TO APRON GA3 VIA PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILANE), EXTENDED TAKE-OFF RUN RWY 09L/27R *THE NOISE SUPPRESSION FACILITY WILL BE CLSD DURING THE CONSTRUCTION WORK IN PHASE 1. DURING THIS TIME, ENGINE TEST RUNS MAY BE CONDUCTED BTN THE APRON AND TAXIWAY INTERSECTION M/F ***PHASE 2: 24MAY24 - 19JUL24*** THE FOLLOWING FACILITIES IN THE AREA OF THE NORTHERN OPERATING AREAS WILL BE CLSD OR RESTRICTED: TWY M BTN THE PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILANE TO GA3 AND RWY 09L/27R, TWY N, TWY Q (CONNECTION TO APRON GA3 VIA PROVISIONAL ACCESS ROAD), EXTENDED TAKE-OFF RUN RWY 27R *RESTRICTIONS OF RWY 09L/27R: TAKE-OFFS FROM RWY 27R REQUIRING A TORA OF MORE THAN 1900 M ARE ONLY POSSIBLE WITH A BACKTRACK PROCEDURE. A YELLOW TAXI GUIDE LINE IN THE AREA OF THRESHOLD 27R CAN BE USED TO GUIDE ACFT THROUGH THE BACKTRACK PROCEDURE. THE BACKTRACK PROCEDURE APPLIES TO ALL ACFT INCLUDING THOSE OF EASA CODE D. AT NIGHT, IN BAD VIS OR IF REQ BY THE PILOT, GUIDANCE BY A FOLLOW-ME VEHICLE FOR THE PROCEDURE SHALL BE REQUESTED FROM HANNOVER GROUND 121.950 MHZ PRIOR TO THE TAXI PROCESS. FOR AIRCRAFT OF EASA CODE E, IT IS POSS TO USE THE FULL TORA OF 3200 M BY MEANS OF A TOWING PROCEDURE STARTING AT THRESHOLD 27R. GUIDANCE WILL BE PROVIDED BY A FOLLOW-ME VEHICLE TO BE REQUESTED VIA HANNOVER GROUND 121.950 MHZ. THIS TOWING PROCEDURE CAN CAUSE A DELAY OF UP TO 30 MINUTES AND, IN THE CASE OF A TAKE-OFF FROM RWY 27R, SHALL BE REQUESTED FROM THE AIRPORT DUTY OFFICER NO LATER THAN 45 MINUTES PRIOR TO THE PLANNED OFFBLOCK TIME. IN THE CASE OF LANDINGS ON RWY 09L REQUIRING AN LDA OF MORE THAN 3200M, A BACKTRACK OR TOWING PROCEDURE SHALL ALSO BE CONDUCTED STARTING AT THRESHOLD 27R BASED ON THE PROCEDURES FOR TAKE-OFFS FROM RWY 27R. ALL ACFT LANDING AT RWY 09L AND UNABLE TO EXIT VIA TWY L EXP BACKTRACK OR TOWING PROC AT THR 27R. LANDING DISTANCE BTN THR RWY 09L AND TWY L 1700M.

PROVISINAL ACCESS TAXILINE WILL BE ESTABLISED TO CONNCECT APN GA3. ALL ACFT FROM AND TO APN GA3 MAY BE TOWED ONLY FROM TWY M WHERE IT MEETS THE PROVISINAL ACCESS TAXILINE. PHASE 1: 26 APR - 24 MAY 2024 THE FOLLOWING AREAS WILL BE CLSD: - RWY 09L/27R - RWY 09C/27C - TWY G, H, J, K, KTO, N - TWY L BTN RWY 09C/27C AND RWY 09L/27R - TWY M BTN PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILINE TO GA3 AND RWY 09L/27R - TWY Q (CONNECTION TO APN GA3 VIA PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILINE) - EXTENDED TKOF RUN RWY 09L/27R NOISE SUPPRESSION FACILITY WILL BE CLSD DURING WIP PHASE 1. ENGINE TEST RUNS MAY BE CONDUCTED BTN APN AND TWY INT M/F. PHASE 2: 24 MAY - 19 JUL 2024 THE FOLLOWING AREAS WILL BE CLSD: - RWY 09C/27C - ONLY AVBL FOR TKOF IN OPERATING DIRECTION 27 - TWY M BTN PROVISIONAL ACCESS TAXILINE TO GA3 AND RWY 09L/27R - TWY N - TWY Q (CONNECTION TO APN GA3 VIA PROVISIONAL ACCESS ROAD) - EXTENDED TKOF RUN RWY 27R RESTRITIONS OF RWY 09L/27R: TKOFS FROM TWY 27R REQUIRING TORA OF MORE THEN 1900M (6234FT) ARE ONLY POSSIBLE WITH BACKTRACK PROC. YELLOW TAXI GUIDE LINE IN THE AREA OF THR RWY 27R CAN BE ISED TO GUIDE ACFT THROUGH THE BACKTRACK PROC. THE BACKTRACK PROC APPLIES TO ALL ACFT INCLUDING CODE LETTER D. AT NIGHT, IN BAD VIS OR IF REQUIRED BY PILOT, GUIDANCE BY FOLLOW-ME SHALL BE REQUESTED FROM HANNOVER GND 121.950 PRIOR TO TAXI PROCESS. FOR CODE LETTER E ACFT IT IS POSSIBLE TO USE FULL TORA OF 3200M (10499FT) BY MEANS OF TOWING PROC STARTING AT THR RWY 27R. GUIDANCE WILL BE PROVIDED BY FOLLOW-ME REQUESTED VIA HANNOVER GND 121.950. TOWING PROC CAN CAUSE DELEY UP TO 30 MIN AND IN CASE OF TKOF FROM RWY 27R SHALL BE REQUESTED FROM APT DUTY OFFICER NO LATER THAN 45 MIN PRIOR TO PLANNED OFFBLOCK TIME. IN CASE OF LDGS ON RWY 09L REQUIRING LDA OF MORE THAN 1320M (4331FT) A BACKTRACK OR TOWING PROC SHALL BE CONDUCTED STARTING AT THR RWY 27R BASED ON PROC FOR TKOF FROM RWY 27R. FURTHER OPS RESTRICTIONS WILL BE PUBLISH VIA NOTAM.

AIRCRAFT WITH RADIO FAILURE MUST OPERATE AS FOLLOWS: DEPARTING AIRCRAFT CONTINUE STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. ARRIVING AIRCRAFT - IF HAS ALREADY RECEIVED TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS, CONTINUES STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE, TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND OR, IF HAS BEEN INSTRUCTED PROCEED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IN ANY CASE NO TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED: - IF IT RECEIVES SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS, VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, IT CLEARS THE LANDING AREA AND WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF IT DOES NOT RECEIVE THESE INSTRUCTIONS VIA LIGHT SIGNALS (FOR EXAMPLE IN THE CASE OF REDUCED VISIBILITY) IT STOPS ON THE RUNWAY, AT THE FIRST AVAILABLE LINK, AND IN ANY CASE BASED ON ANY KNOWN RESTRICTIONS, WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. NOTE: THE INSTRUCTION TO CLEAR THE LANDING AREA, PROVIDED VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, DOES NOT IMPLY CONSTRAINTS ON THE ROUTE TO FOLLOW AND THEREFORE CAN ONLY BE USED WHEN COMPATIBLE WITH THE TRAFFIC SITUATION IN PROGRESS IN THE MANEUVERING AREA REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-13

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

Paragraph.Text: SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
